comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This Powerhouse drove the cable tramway from King Street wharf to Ocean Street Edgecliff from 1894 to electrification in 1905. Ref. www.cable-car-guy.com/html/ccoznz.html

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This "Cable Tram Power House" is marked on this 1903 interactive map, though I cannot tell EXACTLY where - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm1635-sd&rgn=0...

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Thanks for adding this info and those dates. Perhaps the "Cable Tram Power House" on the map is the tiny square under the red line, where the text is?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Found it! It is the marked square north of the road, left of the "C" of 'Cable'. A 'sewer' flowed underneath and into Rushcutters Bay. On old maps there was a bridge there called Bentley's Bridge. Ref. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trams_in_Sydney#Watson.27s_Bay_Line

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Just found this 11/8/1894 Australian Town and Country Journal article which gives full details of the new cable tramway operation and this powerhouse in amazing detail - Article - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/71262625 Illustrations - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/6134354
